intro: Psychotria fenicis, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Amazon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and emits a mild fragrance. Psychotria fenicis is often found in humid, shaded environments within dense rainforests. Its unique botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
